text:
Hey! I’m putting two books in the library that I’ve been meaning to bring in.
1) Live Through This: On Creativity and Self-Destruction
 - This is a really painful but powerful read. It is a compilation of short essays by creatives, writing about their experiences of self-destruction (e.g. self-harm, addiction, eating disorders).
2) Dear Jenny, We Are All Find
- This is a book of poetry by Jenny Zhang, a Chinese American poet based in New York. A lot of her poetry and writing focuses on her experiences as a Chinese American woman.

attachments.title: David McCue | Triumphant? The Art of the Deal
attachments.text: A website showcasing a series of paintings and documentation of a site-specific art event by Glasgow Artist David McCue.
attachments.fallback: David McCue | Triumphant? The Art of the Deal

text: whoa! thanks Melodee, that's very moving art
yes the work is about 6 or 7 years old but it’s sooo current
i also recommend watching his documentary You’ve Been Trumped

is it going to make dislike him more than i already do? i’m not sure how helpful that is at this point :disappointed: reading about his sordid and shitty past made me feel good during the campaign, but now i’m just fucking depressed :disappointed:
:heavy_plus_sign: to that, melissa. just looking at that art ( _it's amazinggggg_ ) made me feel queasy.

attachments.title: Electoral College Electors: Electoral College Make Hillary Clinton President on December 19
attachments.text: On December 19, the Electors of the Electoral College will cast their ballots. If they all vote the way their states voted, Donald Trump will win. However, they can vote for Hillary Clinton if they choose. Even in states where that is not allowed, their vote would still be counted, they would simply...
attachments.fallback: Change.org: Electoral College Electors: Electoral College Make Hillary Clinton President on December 19

text: I want to believe in this, but I felt the same when W first won
honestly, i thought it was done. i don't want to believe in sparkle magic, but i do want to believe in the justice and truths of our system. thank you for sharing this, Melodee.
i'm going to share it, as well.
I know it’s a long shot but its worth it

r.e. understanding the background and history behind trump. i think it’s important to practice self care, and make sure we’re not overwhelming ourselves with negative information. at the same time it’s really important to stay aware of the actual implications of having a person like this take the highest office in the nation. from the link that <@U06DFL7BP> shared in the <#C300Z3U49|civic-tech> channel the other day:

``` Fight normalization in media. We’ll start to see the morning shows doing fluffy profiles of Melania and Ivanka almost immediately, along with “humanizing” articles and profiles of Trump following closely behind. These will be part of a concerted effort to make it seem as if Trump fits into a normal pattern of political practice in this country. We need to steadfastly, aggressively call out this threat by reminding media of his outrageous behavior and holding them accountable.
```
and here’s the link to the full article: <https://medium.com/@anildash/forget-why-its-time-to-get-to-work-c49ac5f0da20#.nfwczz4vj>

attachments.title: Forget “Why?”, it’s time to get to work.
attachments.text: There are going to be endless think-pieces and armchair analyses about why America elected Donald Trump as its next President. But you…
attachments.fallback: Medium: Forget “Why?”, it’s time to get to work.

text: democracy now has an amazing daily podcast that is the main way i stay abreast of the news. today they discussed how the media had a direct impact on trump’s ability to be nominated and elected. very interesting food for thought especially in the coming months/years

attachments.title: A Bystander’s Guide to Standing up Against Islamophobic Harassment (and Other Types of Harassment, Too)
attachments.text: A Paris-based illustrator and filmmaker who goes by the handle Maeril on Tumblr has posted a short and helpful illustrated how-to guide for bystanders who want to step in and help someone experiencing Islamophobic harassment in a public place.
attachments.fallback: A Bystander’s Guide to Standing up Against Islamophobic Harassment (and Other Types of Harassment, Too)
